title: Grades K, 1, 2
subject: College, Career, and Civic Life (C3) Framework for Social Studies State Standards (2017)

document.title: College, Career, and Civic Life (C3) Framework for Social Studies State Standards

8FD3D054C1324873B51A900F09C8D58B.description: Use listening, consensus-building, and voting procedures to decide on and take action in their classrooms.

B185BAC6871D4778BDEF5EC4DE3595A0.description: Identify ways to take action to help address local, regional, and global problems.

C008504D7FBF42B2A81C0E97C2E0B884.description: Identify and explain a range of local, regional, and global problems, and some ways in which people are trying to address these problems.

A612E7A8AD094F71BB2879782FEDDFF7.description: Ask and answer questions about explanations

0AA7C5CBC977426F9DC509DC96BB9C56.description: Ask and answer questions about arguments.

FE9817D6F86B490F899E60F763DCAA1C.description: Present a summary of an argument using print, oral, and digital technologies.

CFF31987FA9A4E1D8C407E6F054D5FFC.description: Construct explanations using correct sequence and relevant information.

02F9594302C448889B92AA374C1FD1B7.description: Evaluate a source by distinguishing between fact and opinion.

3C0118783D5A44EDBFADA65D04AA3873.description: Gather relevant information from one or two sources while using the origin and structure to guide the selection.

A255BE852C544D9EA17C9CDEED1130CF.description: Select which reasons might be more likely than others to explain a historical event or development.

84A4122CB19845C9B954B10B8BBBEEFD.description: Generate possible reasons for an event or development in the past.

D00050A8D67E4EED8A5DBFCCB4EE53F0.description: Generate questions about a particular historical source as it relates to a particular historical event or development.

CFEFCA7F97384A90AC89CEEF292238B6.description: Identify the maker, date, and place of origin for a historical source from information within the source itself.

F7805016810049A295BB71CD7336ADFA.description: Explain how historical sources can be used to study the past.

201FA6E3B643484D9ABE50FEBD8DB2A1.description: Identify different kinds of historical sources.

FE9BB069CA554C6CB4691B8D6A4368A4.description: Compare different accounts of the same historical event.

7747354059CE4A8EBAFD25D680E180CC.description: Compare perspectives of people in the past to those of people in the present.

D8EB4645E4274B4F916F1735E92EA210.description: Generate questions about individuals and groups who have shaped a significant historical change.

74E306B7FF2146DA90F72D61B35BB7CE.description: Compare life in the past to life today.

A3E10CC39B7A47B5A8BCFBBC621A7AD4.description: Create a chronological sequence of multiple events.

3096DD2762C54CCB88B1033CD8AC915E.description: Identify ways that a catastrophic disaster may affect people living in a place.

DC2AE612195649468981F1B7CD9D96D6.description: Explain how the consumption of products connects people to distant places.

AD8CFC452A6D411990F3F70532CC561D.description: Describe changes in the physical and cultural characteristics of various world regions.

7487B216D2C446DCA434F4D608A387AF.description: Describe the connections between the physical environment of a place and the economic activities found there.

465A5E1BA808416EAA10FBD269817E09.description: Compare how people in different types of communities use local and distant environments to meet their daily needs.

9A9413DD55E84C71AE1CC3DCFBD4A9DA.description: Explain why and how people, goods, and ideas move from place to place.

19D734BE5539416E9A747584111EA243.description: Human Population: Spatial Patterns and Movements

98F6D32B30C0402A8B635DBA856B7898.description: Identify some cultural and environmental characteristics of specific places.

788359FEB7184C89BACE1C43828F4654.description: Describe how human activities affect the cultural and environmental characteristics of places or regions.

28D760A5DE3E48038166CC9B1FFB6BFE.description: Explain how weather, climate, and other environmental characteristics affect people's lives in a place or region.

D8E89068021144A9948D26D25AFC6FB5.description: Human-Environment Interaction: Place, Regions, and Culture

02CB9757E3774564B4FB9EDC8D3D558D.description: Use maps, globes, and other simple geographic models to identify cultural and environmental characteristics of places.

28FFC4AAC3844EA18C10E13752213437.description: Use maps, graphs, photographs, and other representations to describe places and the relationships and interactions that shape them.

6FFF4E4FB36D4AEEA49A0F71EA9FCEF5.description: Construct maps, graphs, and other representations of familiar places.

03C973F307934883BA274AADEA064D48.description: Geographic Representations: Spatial Views of the World

8E97F5DBCB6B4DBEA3FEA0FE3809C008.description: Describe products that are produced abroad and sold domestically and products that are produced domestically and sold abroad.

9814ABC36E6B4552B91E7331A4088929.description: Describe why people in one country trade goods and services with people in other countries.

7F76A1233B234292B2AAB6607BC74C7D.description: Describe examples of capital goods and human capital.

6EA9C929638043C29608DB33F3A7DA50.description: Describe examples of the goods and services that governments provide.

64EE45C4A0864D81959DB6FDFBF69F37.description: Describe the role of banks in an economy.

74589495122F42D4B90D46E9AFDA0372.description: Describe examples of costs of production.

900068D8B16D4554909E15314FBBFC9D.description: Identify prices of products in a local market.

7D15AD203D524EA3B360A4F84EB1622E.description: Describe the goods and services that people in the local community produce and those that are produced in other communities.

16E4EBC1B50944DD9D51FFA7B656FF9C.description: Describe the skills and knowledge required to produce certain goods and services.

B01A35D242DE46C4B438D6D35B9BFF57.description: Identify the benefits and costs of making various personal decisions.

7F37DE9100C247BAA492702B60E15E0C.description: Explain how scarcity necessitates decision making.

5675A3536B17496283489ADF811DDA59.description: Describe how people have tried to improve their communities over time.

0F23EDB76F594AA6AE5315BCF4C47BFC.description: Identify and explain how rules function in public (classroom and school) settings.

BCC92E31F0BE45ECA3DF0BDA22475171.description: Explain how people can work together to make decisions in the classroom.

A65E3B11AF304024B2B44A20E5625948.description: Compare their own point of view with others' perspectives.

79D0B0563E3D4827AE251ADB41268F6A.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions while responding attentively to others when addressing ideas and making decisions as a group.

A0574658CFBE45DBB8735C21A5C4D95E.description: Describe democratic principles such as equality, fairness, and respect for legitimate authority and rules.

2FAB5703B39D412EBAC511DD29CBBF2A.description: Apply civic virtues when participating in school settings.

5A7B3332EF1342C1A5EC311534C6A603.description: Participation and Deliberation: Applying Civic Virtues and Democratic Principles

CE6903A21E184D009BEF90D69F3A58EA.description: Describe how communities work to accomplish common tasks, establish responsibilities, and fulfill roles of authority.

E1B63546580C4D58BD30BE79A8CC83E0.description: Explain what governments are and some of their functions.

8A8A305E86534B5ABE9985F1202DB881.description: Explain the need for and purposes of rules in various settings inside and outside of school.

4F1FCF07077C47AE8C001D83A7F6F104.description: Explain how all people, not just official leaders, play important roles in a community.

D64AAEFBB8364186A96DBC53B5B0FC30.description: Describe roles and responsibilities of people in authority.

79E6708CD934458982F65B3A29A8EB16.description: Determine the kinds of sources that will be helpful in answering compelling and supporting questions.

981C35F3FF9241FBABE07A81AF5A5E0F.description: Make connections between supporting questions and compelling questions.

20F7F3844E7849BE94B09551008D77AC.description: Identify facts and concepts associated with a supporting question.

EFAF983D08DA4D4195C6C655D754CEE7.description: Identify disciplinary ideas associated with a compelling question.

16DC1D1D67A144A68213D2EA6A4C62A5.description: Explain why the compelling question is important to the student.
